column1: Narrator : A very high, needle looking rock shoots up from the waves out of the ocean. As you approach, you can discern that a staircase has been carved in it.
PlayerSpeak : That’s too high, no thanks!
column2: PlayerSpeak : Somethin' good HAS to be up there. Let’s go, mateys!

column1: Narrator : After climbing up the stairs for hours, the crew arrives to the top. There only stands a small cottage, relentlessly battered by strong winds.
PlayerSpeak : It be too dangerous here, we’re leaving.

column2: OtherSpeak : Hello there, adventurers of the sea!

column5: Choice : Do ye know anythin' about NOMTRESOR?
OtherSpeak : That damned thing? Of course I do.

column3: OtherSpeak : I’ll see in the pantry if I have anything to spare.
column4: OtherSpeak : I’m afraid I don't have anything to spare, sorry lads!
column5: OtherSpeak : My son went after this legend and never came back.
OtherSpeak : Before he left, the only word he mentioned was FORMULA.

column2: OtherSpeak : YOU! How dare you come back here?!

column1: Narrator : The house is empty. The long dead body of the owner is laying on the floor.
Narrator : On the desk, CAPITAINE reads on a piece of paper a scribbled word.
